meanings.sent1: Workers decided to unionize to improve their working conditions.
meanings.sent2: Many employees unionize to have a stronger voice in negotiations.
meanings.sent3: Why did the factory workers decide to unionize? To have more power!
meanings.sent4: In a way, unionizing is like joining forces to fight for common goals.
meanings.sent5: The workers' decision to unionize was a turning point in their fight for fair treatment.

meanings.definition: To join or become a member of a labor union.
meanings.sent1: She chose to unionize to support her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: New employees often unionize soon after starting their job.
meanings.sent3: When asked why he wanted to unionize, he simply replied, 'Solidarity!'
meanings.sent4: Joining a union is like unionizing with others to protect your rights.
meanings.sent5: The workers were excited to unionize and stand together for better pay.
